article.headline: San Diego 70, Santa Clara 65
article.story: SAN DIEGO -- Johnny Dee scored 19 points to lead San Diego to a 70-65 win over Santa Clara on Saturday night, running the Broncos' losing streak to 11 games. San Diego (9-14, 4-7 West Coast) twice had 19-points leads early in the second half before Santa Clara (8-15, 0-10) cut the margin to 68-65 when Evan Roquemore hit two free throws with 12.6 seconds left. But Dennis Kramer made a pair of free throws with 11.6 seconds left for the final margin. Dee, a freshman, hit five 3-pointers for the Toreros, who held a big advantage at the free-throw line. San Diego made 25 of 39 free throws, while the Broncos were 15 of 18 in a game where 47 total fouls were called. Christopher Anderson scored 13 points for San Diego. Roquemore scored all of his 21 points in the second half while Denzel Johnson added 20 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
